items.title: Pinduoduo to invest $13.7b to aid merchants
items.summary:
- Pinduoduo, a Chinese e-commerce platform, plans to invest 100 billion yuan ($13.7 billion) over the next three years.
- The investment is aimed at enhancing the transformation and upgrading of merchants on its platform.
- The announcement was made on April 3.

items.title: AirTrunk pursues $1.7b green loan for major Singapore data center
items.summary:
- AirTrunk is seeking a US$1.7 billion green loan for a new data center in Singapore.
- The data center will have an 80.2-megawatt capacity and will operate under long-term contracts until December 31, 2050.
- The project is being developed for a major US client, with AirTrunk expected to lease some power back.

items.title: Thailand’s richest man’s $21.4b company debuts on stock market
items.author: Sarath Ratanavadi
items.summary:
- Gulf Development debuted on the stock exchange on Apr. 3 after merging Gulf Energy Development and Intouch Holdings Pcl.
- The new entity had a market valuation of 736 billion baht (around US$21.4 billion), down 13% from the pre-merger value.
- The stock opened at 49.75 baht (around US$1.45) and rose 1% despite economic challenges including a 36% US tariff and a recent earthquake in Myanmar.
- The merger combines power, infrastructure, and LNG operations with telecom assets, including a major stake in Advanced Info Service, Thailand’s second-largest mobile operator.
- This merger is part of Ratanavadi's strategy to expand into high-growth sectors like AI and data centers.

items.title: MobiKwik stock drops 56% from peak following Q3 losses
US Dollar Weakens as Trump Announces New Tariffs
items.summary:
- The US dollar weakened on Apr. 3 after Trump announced new tariffs on imports effective Apr. 9.
- Tariffs include a 10% baseline levy and higher duties on goods from 60 countries, raising global economic slowdown concerns.
- Global stocks declined; demand for bonds and gold increased; the yen rose 1.3% to 147.39 per dollar.
- Asian currencies suffered, with China's yuan hitting its weakest levels; other currencies like the ringgit and won also declined.
- The dollar index fell to 102.98, its lowest since October, marking a 4% decline this year.

items.title: Green shoots in greentech logistics
D2C snacking brand Sweet Karam Coffee nets $8m series A
items.summary:
- Sweet Karam Coffee, a Chennai-based D2C snacking brand, has raised US$8 million in series A funding led by Peak XV Partners, with participation from Fireside Ventures.
- The funding will assist in expanding its product range and geographical reach.
- Founded in 2015, the company offers South Indian snacks, sweets, condiments, ghee, and filter coffee, selling across 32 countries via ecommerce and quick commerce channels.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article features a list of Indonesian startups on the rise based on recent funding rounds.
- It only includes companies that have reached up to series E stage.
- Each entry provides key details about their funding rounds.
- The information is generated using Tech in Asia data and is constantly updated.
- Additional resources are available, including a comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia and the research methodology used.

items.title: Australia dodges US tariffs, but faces economic risks
items.summary:
- Australia avoids steep reciprocal tariffs imposed by the US under Trump, facing only a general 10% tariff.
- Exempt from higher tariffs impacting countries like China, Japan, and South Korea.
- Australian beef farmers may face challenges due to new trade barriers; gold and pharmaceuticals are exempted.
- Prime Minister Anthony Albanese criticizes tariffs as unwarranted but notes Australia is better off than others.
- Foreign minister Penny Wong emphasizes impact on Asian economies and the need for calm amid disruptions.
- Analysts warn tariffs could slow construction and manufacturing in North Asia, affecting Australia’s economy.
- Economic slowdown in China, Australia’s top trading partner, poses risks to resource-heavy regions, especially Western Australia.

items.title: Hong Kong IPOs surge as AI hype fuels investor interest
OnlyFans founder joins bid for TikTok’s US operations
items.summary:
- Tim Stokely, founder of OnlyFans, partners with Zoop and The Hbar Foundation to bid for TikTok's US operations.
- TikTok faces an April 5 deadline to sell or risk a ban.
- Other bidders include Amazon and a consortium of Oracle and Blackstone.
- A proposal suggests ByteDance may retain TikTok's algorithm, needing approval from the Chinese government.

items.title: Xiaomi Hits Record 29k EV Sales in March
items.summary:
- Xiaomi achieved over 29,000 car deliveries in March, setting a new monthly record.
- This marks its sixth consecutive month of over 20,000 deliveries.
- A fatal accident involving a Xiaomi SU7 in autopilot mode led to three deaths, and investigations are ongoing.
- Competitors Xpeng and Leapmotor also reported strong deliveries: Xpeng sold 33,205 units and Leapmotor 37,095 units in March.
- BYD remains the market leader with 371,419 deliveries, a 57.9% increase, while Tesla saw an 11.5% decline, with 78,828 units sold.
- In Q1 2025, BYD led with 986,098 vehicles sold, followed by Tesla with 172,754 units.
- China's EV market is expanding rapidly, with increasing demand following earlier slowdowns.

items.title: Honor sets up embodied AI labs, expands into robotics
items.summary:
- Honor has launched a new incubation department to focus on embodied AI and robotics.
- The company is establishing five labs: Embodied AI Lab, Embodied Data Lab, Interactive Security Lab, Powertrain Lab, and Bionic Body Research Lab.
- Honor is hiring for key positions to support this initiative, including robot data generation algorithm engineers and integrated joint designers.

items.title: Indonesian rupiah sinks to 27-year low over US tariffs impact
items.summary:
- The Indonesian rupiah fell to 16,754 rupiah per US dollar as of Apr. 3, the lowest in 27 years since the 1998 financial crisis.
- Before the Ied holiday on Mar. 27, the rupiah closed at 16,555 rupiah per US dollar, up by 0.12%.
- The decline follows the US announcement of tariffs up to 32% on Indonesian exports, threatening export competitiveness and demand.
- Analysts caution that continued pressure might decrease Indonesia’s US dollar reserves and further strain the rupiah.

items.title: US imposes 26% tariff on Indian imports to push trade deal
items.summary:
- The US government has imposed a 26% tariff on Indian imports, one of the highest among major trading partners.
- Previous tariffs included 20% on the EU, 24% on Japan, 25% on South Korea, and at least 54% on many Chinese goods.
- President Trump justified the decision by citing India's unfair tariffs on US goods, which can be as high as 52%. 
- The tariff hike aims to pressure India into negotiating a trade agreement.

items.title: S Korea announces emergency measures over US tariffs
items.author: Han Duck-soo, Choi Sang-mok
items.summary:
- South Korea's acting President Han Duck-soo announced emergency measures for businesses due to new US tariffs on exports, with a 25% rate applied.
- Concerns rise in Seoul regarding the impact on the export-driven economy.
- Han instructed the industry minister to analyze tariffs and communicate with the US government regarding effects.
- Trump's tariffs target South Korea and Japan for alleged unfair trade practices, raising concerns among analysts about potential economic fallout, particularly in auto and electronics sectors.
- South Korea's KOSPI index dropped 2.7%, impacting automakers and chipmakers.
- Finance Minister Choi Sang-mok stated they would take action to stabilize financial markets if needed.

items.title: Japan’s Nikkei hits 8-month low after Trump tariff shock
items.summary:
• Japan’s Nikkei share average dropped to an eight-month low on Apr. 3, following new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.
• The index fell 4.6% in early trading to 34,102.00, the lowest since August 2024.
• By midday, the index was down 3% at 34,673.69 with 206 of 225 companies declining. 
• The Topix index also fell by 3.3% after a 4.3% drop.
• Banks suffered the most, with a 7.2% decline; Resona Holdings dropped 9.5%.
• The chip sector also faced losses, with Tokyo Electron down 4.2% and Advantest losing 3.3%.
• Exporters, particularly automakers like Toyota, were pressured by a stronger yen.
• A 25% duty on car exports to the US is set to take effect later today.
• Japanese officials are considering options; analysts warn of likely market volatility.

items.title: Shein, Temu face changes as Trump ends de minimis loophole
items.summary:
- President Trump signed an executive order to end the de minimis trade loophole, effective May 2.
- Shipments valued below $800 will now incur a duty of 30% or $25 per item, raising to $50 per item on June 1.
- The change follows logistical challenges faced by US Customs and delivery companies.
- The de minimis provision previously fueled growth for Chinese platforms like Temu and Shein, with US Customs processing over 1.3 billion shipments in 2024.
- Critics argue the loophole benefitted Chinese retailers and facilitated counterfeit goods.
- Both Temu and Shein are expanding US operations, with Temu utilizing US warehouses and Shein opening distribution centers.

items.title: China urges US to remove new tariffs, threatens action
items.summary:
- China urges the US to remove new tariffs and warns of countermeasures to protect its interests.
- President Trump announced a 34% tariff on Chinese goods, which, combined with an earlier 20% tariff, totals a 54% levy.
- The new tariffs will take effect on April 5, with additional tariffs set for April 9.
- Trump removed the "de minimis" rule, affecting low-value packages from China and Hong Kong.
- The tariffs are a result of China not meeting purchasing targets from the 2020 "Phase 1" trade deal, with imports in 2024 reaching US$164 billion, falling short of the US$200 billion target.

items.title: Aspire secures licence to launch investment service
items.summary:
- Aspire has received a Capital Markets Services (CMS) Licence from the Monetary Authority of Singapore on Apr. 3.
- The licence allows Aspire to offer regulated investment solutions for businesses in Singapore, including a new service called Aspire Yield.
- Aspire Yield offers startups and small businesses no minimum investment, no lock-up period, and next-business-day liquidity, currently in private beta with a waitlist.
- Aspire serves over 50,000 companies worldwide across nine countries.

items.title: AI sales tech startup Actively AI bags $22.5m
items.summary:
- Actively AI, a New York-based startup, has raised $22.5 million in total funding, including a $17.5 million Series A led by Bain Capital Ventures.
- The startup was founded in 2022 and focuses on AI-powered sales prospecting tools that analyze company data to identify potential prospects.
- Unlike traditional AI tools, Actively's platform replicates successful human sales reps' decision-making processes.
- It utilizes proprietary models in conjunction with models from OpenAI and Anthropic.
- The company claims significant growth, generating revenue for clients like fintech company Ramp, though exact annual recurring revenue (ARR) has not been disclosed.

items.title: The practical lessons in Grab’s AI marketing playbook
items.author: Alson Ang
items.summary:
- Consumers demand personalized brand interactions, presenting a challenge for companies.
- Generative AI can enhance marketing by maintaining brand consistency while delivering tailored messages.
- McKinsey study indicates personalization can increase revenue by 10-15%, with 71% of consumers wanting customized experiences.
- Grab utilizes AI for various marketing messages, from push notifications to personalized emails.
- Challenges include the difficulty of crafting unique messages and maintaining brand voice across different regions.
- Key AI technologies leveraged include Machine Learning for user classification, Large Language Models for content generation, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation for content customization.

items.title: Japanese bank SMBC partners with Fujitsu AI for corporate advice
items.summary:
• Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC) is collaborating with Fujitsu to enhance corporate advisory services using AI models.
• The partnership aims to assist clients with rising costs by optimizing decisions on staffing, procurement, and financing.
• This initiative is notable as it involves the sharing of sensitive client data with an external company, which is rare for Japanese banks.
• Neither SMBC nor Fujitsu provided comments on ongoing negotiations.

items.title: Paris-based VC firm Revaia nets $272.8m, hits $654.8m AUM
items.author: Alice Albizzati, Elina Berrebi
items.summary:
- Revaia raised €250 million (US$272.81 million) for its second growth fund, Revaia Growth II.
- Total assets under management now stand at €600 million (US$654.75 million).
- Investors include Bpifrance SACA, European Investment Fund, and JPMorgan Chase & Co.
- The British Business Bank contributed €20 million after Revaia's London office opened.
- About one-third of commitments came from international investors.
- Approximately 40% of the fund has been deployed into six investments in sectors like energy transition, AI for insurance, and cybersecurity.
- Revaia focuses on B2B SaaS companies and was founded in 2018.

items.title: US increases tariffs to 32% on Indonesian imports
items.summary:
[US President Donald Trump announced an increase in import tariffs, with Indonesia's tariff now set at 32%.]
[Other Southeast Asian countries face higher rates: Thailand at 36% and Cambodia at 49%.]
[China will experience an additional 34% tariff, totaling 54%.]
[The policy aims to address significant trade surpluses and strengthen US manufacturing.]

items.title: Trump imposes 32% tariff on Taiwan to address trade gap
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump announced a 32% tariff on goods from Taiwan as part of new tariffs on imports from various trading partners.
- This announcement was made during an event in the Rose Garden on April 2.
- The tariffs will be implemented in two phases, starting with a 10% tax on all imports from April 5, followed by higher rates for specific countries on April 9.
- The policy aims to reduce trade imbalances and promote domestic manufacturing.
- Economists express concerns over potential risks, including trade wars, higher inflation, and disruptions in global trade networks.

items.title: Trump announces 34% tariff on Chinese imports
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump announced a 34% tariff on Chinese imports starting April 5, 2023.
- The tariff increases from a 10% baseline to an additional 24% on April 9, 2023.
- An executive order was signed to end duty exemptions for low-value shipments from China effective May 2, 2023.
- China's embassy criticized the tariffs, stating that protectionism leads nowhere.
- The impact of these tariffs on US consumers and industries is under assessment, with concerns for US countries reliant on exports to China.

items.title: Adtech firm AppLovin in talks to acquire TikTok as US seeks buyer
items.summary:
- AppLovin is reportedly in talks to acquire TikTok, as sourced by CNBC.
- The Trump administration is looking for a US-based owner for TikTok, amidst a potential ban by April 5 due to national security concerns.
- The divestment deadline was extended from January 19 by 75 days, but it's uncertain if AppLovin will acquire TikTok’s non-Chinese operations.

items.title: US Tariffs Impact Southeast Asia with High Rates for Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos
items.summary:
- On Apr. 2, the US imposed tariffs of 10% to 49% on several Southeast Asian nations under the "Liberation Day" initiative.
- Cambodia, Laos, and Vietnam face the highest tariffs at 49%, 48%, and 46%, respectively.
- Other affected countries include Myanmar (44%), Thailand (36%), Indonesia (32%), Brunei (24%), Malaysia (24%), the Philippines (17%), Timor-Leste (10%), and Singapore (10%).
- The White House claims the tariffs address unfair trade practices, but critics argue they are based on trade surplus data.
- The tariffs may significantly impact economies reliant on exports, particularly Vietnam, which relies on US trade for 29% of total exports.
- Cambodia's garment industry, heavily reliant on the US, is expected to suffer.
- Analysts warn the move could weaken trust in US partnerships, especially with Vietnam amidst strengthening ties.

items.title: US tariffs on Vietnam could hit Nike, Adidas hard
items.summary:
- The US is considering tariffs on imports from Vietnam, targeting brands like Nike and Adidas.
- The decision is expected on April 2, aimed at boosting domestic production and addressing trade imbalances.
- Vietnam has a significant trade surplus with the US, amounting to $123.5 billion.
- Nike produces 50% of its footwear and 28% of its apparel in Vietnam, while Adidas sources 39% of its footwear and 18% of its apparel there.
- Smaller brands like On rely heavily on Vietnam, with 90% of shoes and 60% of apparel sourced there.
- Current US tariffs on Vietnamese footwear average 13.6% and 18.8% on apparel, with potential increases raising costs for brands.
- Nike is already experiencing market share losses and projected revenue declines, which could worsen with new tariffs.
- Production relocation is costly and complex, and other Southeast Asian countries may also face tariffs.
- Vietnamese leaders are working to mitigate impacts by increasing US imports and reducing duties.

items.title: Payoneer founder launches new startup in Israel for creators
items.summary:
- The founder of Payoneer has launched a new startup aimed at supporting creators in Israel.
- The startup focuses on providing financial and operational solutions for content creators.
- This initiative is part of a broader trend of supporting the growing creator economy.

items.title: Carsome partners with Google Cloud for AI, cloud upgrade
Ex-Google researcher joins AgiBot as chief scientist
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Luo Jianlan joins AgiBot as chief scientist to lead the Zhiyuan Embodied Intelligence Research Centre in Shanghai.
- AgiBot, founded in 2023 by Peng Zhihui, aims to enhance its AI and robotics capabilities under Luo’s direction.
- Luo has a PhD from UC Berkeley and has experience with Google X and DeepMind, focusing on machine learning and robotics.

items.title: Tesla faces decline in China sales as local competitors grow
items.summary:
- Tesla's sales in China are declining due to increasing competition from local brands.
- Local electric vehicle manufacturers are capturing significant market share.
- The market dynamics in China are shifting, impacting Tesla's growth strategy.
- Analysts suggest that Tesla needs to adapt its business model to remain competitive in the region.

items.title: BCG’s revenue hit $13.5b in 2024, driven by AI demand
items.summary:
- BCG reported a revenue of $13.5 billion in 2024.
- The increase in revenue is primarily driven by demand for AI services.
- Analysis highlights the growing importance of AI in consulting business models.

items.title: Foxconn boosts investments in India, Vietnam for AI servers
items.summary:
- Foxconn announces plans to increase investment in AI server production in India and Vietnam.
- The initiative is part of a broader strategy to diversify supply chains and reduce reliance on China.
- The company's move reflects growing demand for AI infrastructure globally.

items.title: Israeli AI-powered voice firm Hi Auto raises $15m series A
items.summary:
- Hi Auto, an Israel-based AI voice technology startup, raised $15 million in Series A funding, totaling $23 million raised so far.
- The funding round was led by Delek Motors, the Zisapel Family, and Vasuki Tech Fund, with participation from other investors.
- The company aims to expand in the quick-service restaurant (QSR) sector and enhance its AI voice technology for drive-thru services.
- Hi Auto's SaaS platform automates drive-thru ordering with over 96% accuracy and 90% order completion, addressing labor cost and staffing challenges.

items.title: AI giants seek reduced regulation under Trump administration
items.summary:
- Executives from major AI companies, including OpenAI, Google, and Meta, are seeking reduced regulation under the Trump administration.
- President Trump, in office since January 2025, is focused on accelerating AI development and repealing Biden-era regulations aimed at privacy and transparency.
- AI companies, including OpenAI, are lobbying for favorable federal policies to prevent state-level regulations, citing competition from China's AI progress.
- Companies are also pushing for federal support to classify AI training on copyrighted materials as "fair use" amid ongoing lawsuits.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia launched Glasswall to assist founders in choosing the right venture capitalists (VCs).
- Founders can anonymously share reviews about VCs, addressing the common practice of discreet comments about investors.
- The initiative aims to provide candid feedback to VCs and empower entrepreneurs with information for better decision-making.

items.title: Tesla stock jumps 5% after Musk US gov’t exit rumor
items.summary:
- Tesla shares rose over 5% on Apr. 2 after speculation that Elon Musk may resign from the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- White House dismissed the report as "garbage," while Musk called it "fake" on X, despite the stock rebounding after a 6.4% initial drop due to weak Q1 delivery numbers.
- Report claims Musk and Trump agreed he would focus on his businesses, with Musk potentially leaving his government role after 130 days as a special employee.
- Tesla shares dropped over 31% this year, with a significant 36% decline in Q1, its worst since 2022.
- Musk's government position has reportedly triggered protests and boycotts, amid concerns about Trump’s auto tariffs affecting Tesla's suppliers.
- NYC Comptroller Brad Lander has urged legal action for alleged misrepresentation of Musk’s involvement affecting NYC pension funds.
- Musk faces scrutiny for political activities, including a rally for a Republican candidate, raising concerns about the impact on Tesla's interests.

items.title: Chinese tech giants bought $16b in Nvidia H20 chips in Q1 2025
items.summary:
- ByteDance, Alibaba, and Tencent ordered over $16 billion worth of Nvidia H20 chips in Q1 2025.
- The H20 is Nvidia’s most advanced AI chip available in China under US export restrictions tightened in October 2023.
- The startup DeepSeek has increased demand for H20 by using it for cost-effective AI models despite US limits on Nvidia’s top chips.
- Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expects minimal short-term impact from restrictions and plans to shift production to the US.

items.title: Trump-linked Truth Social operator plans $2.3b stock sale
items.summary:
- Trump Media & Technology Group filed documents with the US SEC for a potential US$2.3 billion stock sale.
- The company operates Truth Social, a social media platform associated with President Donald Trump.
- Following the filing, shares of Trump Media dropped approximately 7% in premarket trading on April 2.

items.title: Automattic lays off 280 employees amid legal challenges
items.author: Matt Mullenweg
items.summary:
- Automattic laid off about 280 employees, reducing its workforce by 16% from 1,777 to 1,495.
- CEO Matt Mullenweg stated layoffs were essential for the company's long-term future.
- Automattic is involved in a legal dispute with WP Engine, which could have serious financial implications.

items.title: SG now has 49 billionaires, up from 39 in 2024: Forbes
items.summary:
- Singapore now has 49 billionaires, an increase from 39 in 2024, with a combined wealth of US$145.2 billion.
- Goh Cheng Liang is the richest person in Singapore with a net worth of US$13 billion, ranking 182nd globally.
- New billionaires include Quek Leng Chye and Lim Kaling, with notable figures like Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and Jeff Bezos topping the global list.

items.title: Tech stocks drop after Trump’s new tariffs announcement
items.summary:
- Tech stocks declined on Apr. 2 following Trump's announcement of new tariffs on imports.
- New tariffs range from 10% to 49%, with Apple leading the drop at over 6% losses.
- Nvidia, Tesla, Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta also experienced losses between 2.5% and 5%.
- Specific tariffs include 10% on all imports, 34% on China, 20% on Europe, and 24% on Japan.
- The S&P 500 ETF dropped 2.8%, and the Nasdaq 100 ETF fell over 3% amid negative market sentiment.
- The Nasdaq faced its worst quarter since 2022, down 10% in Q1 2023.

items.title: Google’s Gemini AI leader Sissie Hsiao steps down
items.summary:
- Sissie Hsiao has stepped down from leading Google's AI chatbot, Bard, now known as Gemini.
- Josh Woodward, head of Google Labs, will take over her responsibilities while keeping his current role.
- Hsiao plans to take a short break before returning to Google in a new capacity.
- Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, stated the leadership change aims to support the evolution of the Gemini app.
- Last year, Google's Gemini team was moved to DeepMind to streamline its generative AI operations.

items.title: AI insurance platform FurtherAI bags $5m seed funding
items.summary:
- FurtherAI has secured US$5 million in seed funding led by Nexus Venture Partners.
- The funding will be used to expand its AI team, enhance products, and strengthen commercial insurance presence.
- FurtherAI plans to enter the UK market amidst rising AI adoption in insurance.
- The company automates underwriting, compliance, and claims processing with 95%-97% accuracy, surpassing manual processing.
- Insurers managing over US$15 billion in premiums utilize FurtherAI to improve efficiency and underwriter productivity.
- The investment underscores interest in AI solutions addressing traditional industry inefficiencies like rising expenses and talent shortages.

items.title: Asia layoff tracker: AI shift triggers layoffs at Zomato
items.summary:
- Zomato is experiencing layoffs due to an increased shift towards AI technologies.
- The company is restructuring its workforce in response to market demands and operational efficiencies.
- The impact of AI on employment is a growing concern across the industry.
- This change reflects broader trends in the tech sector regarding automation and workforce realignment.
- The article provides a detailed overview of the ongoing layoffs in Asia related to AI advancements.

items.title: Amazon reportedly makes last-minute bid to acquire TikTok
items.summary:
- Amazon has made a last-minute bid to acquire TikTok ahead of the Apr. 5 divestment deadline for ByteDance.
- The bid was communicated in a letter to Vice President JD Vance and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, although its seriousness is disputed.
- Following the news, Amazon’s shares increased by 1.3%.
- The divestment deadline is due to a national security law regarding ByteDance's ownership.
- An executive order by President Trump delayed enforcement of the law by 75 days.
- Interest in acquiring TikTok has been expressed by multiple parties, as the platform is used by nearly half of Americans.

items.title: Tesla Q1 deliveries fall 13%, miss investor estimates
items.summary:
- Tesla delivered 336,000 vehicles in Q1 2025, a 13% drop from 2024 and below investor expectations of 360,000–370,000.
- Production reached 345,454 units, mainly from Model 3 and Model Y with 323,800 deliveries.
- Factory shutdowns for Model Y upgrades contributed to the decline despite CEO Elon Musk's optimism.
- Tesla’s market share fell notably in Europe (9.3% from 17.9%), Germany (4% from 16%), and a significant drop in China.
- Tesla’s stock fell 36% in Q1, erasing $460 billion in market value due to brand struggles and increasing competition.
